Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were allocated to a standard‐care control group or an exercise group

Intervention.evidence: Patients were allocated to a standard‐care control group or an exercise group, who were prescribed standard care plus twice‐weekly high‐intensity aerobic exercise and resistance training sessions.

Objective.evidence: This study examined the safety and feasibility of preoperative exercise training during neoadjuvant treatment in these patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the incidence of serious adverse events (SAEs) that prevented surgery

Result_Outcome.evidence: The risk of failure to reach surgery was 5 versus 21 per cent in the control group (risk ratio (RR) 0·23, 95 per cent c.i. 0·04 to 1·29)

Harms.evidence: The incidence of SAEs was not increased in the exercise group.
